text: Listen to ‘The Daily’The latest from protests in Minneapolis.

Protests Erupt Across U.S. Over George Floyd’s DeathPresident Trump criticized the authorities in Minnesota for allowing protests to turn violent.Minnesota’s governor activated all National Guard troops but declined the Army’s offer of military police.Unrest and fires spread overnight far beyond Minneapolis, with demonstrations swelling in dozens of cities. Here’s the latest.
Protests Over George Floyd Death Reach Trump Tower and Across N.Y.C.In a third day of demonstrations, protesters also blocked the West Side Highway and scuffled with the police in Brooklyn.
Appeals for Calm as Sprawling Protests Threaten to Spiral Out of ControlOutrage over the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis has traversed a razor’s edge between protest and civic meltdown.
Thousands of Complaints Do Little to Change Police WaysEfforts to hold problem officers accountable face resistance from unions, and juries are reluctant to second-guess.
“Let my building burn.” A Bangladeshi family lost their restaurant in the chaos, but still support the protesters.
Here’s what top conservatives are saying about George Floyd and police brutality.

Analysis: In Days of Discord, a President Fans the FlamesPresident Trump has presented himself as someone who seeks conflict, not conciliation, a fighter, not a peacemaker. And he has lived up to his self-image at an inopportune time.
President Trump threatened protesters outside the White House with “vicious dogs” and “ominous weapons.”

Twitter Had Been Drawing a Line for Months When Trump Crossed ItInside the company, one faction wanted Jack Dorsey to take a hard line against President Trump’s tweets while another urged him to remain hands-off.
SpaceX Lifts NASA Astronauts to Orbit, Launching New Era of SpaceflightThe trip to the space station was the first from American soil since 2011 when the space shuttles were retired.
Elon Musk’s SpaceX Suit Is Like a Tuxedo for the Starship EnterpriseIt also may herald the return of wearable tech.

Major U.S. Cities Ease Restrictions, as Global Caseload Nears 6 MillionNew York City, Washington and Los Angeles announced reopening plans. But as global infections tick up, cautionary tales abound.Churches in California are planning Sunday services that would defy the state’s attendance limits. Here’s the latest.
As New York City looks to reopen, officials are focusing on hot spots and preparing hospitals for new cases.
In Harm’s Way: The FallenHere are some of the health care workers who lost their lives in the fight against the coronavirus.
Natalie Mead set up an 'I Spy' game with hidden figurines and toys around her succulent-filled yard.
How to Get Your Money to Those Who Need It More Than YouThese services bridge the gap between Venmoing someone from Twitter and a check to a big charity that could steer that money anywhere.
Do Runners Need to Wear Masks?Some people have taken to yelling (online and off) at people exercising without masks. But does it really matter?
11 of Our Best Weekend ReadsThe Central Park bird watcher speaks. A re-examination of the chopstick. Farewell, Larry Kramer. Face-timing Pamela Anderson. And more.

Minnesota’s Governor Activates National GuardDemonstrators amassed across the country in a showing of anger over the death of George Floyd, a black man who died in police custody in Minneapolis.President Trump urged officials in Minnesota to “get tougher,” but Gov. Tim Walz declined the Army’s offer to deploy military police.Officials feared that the most dangerous standoffs were yet to come in Minneapolis on Saturday night. Here’s the latest.

Standoffs Intensify Over the Death of George FloydDemonstrations escalated throughout Saturday, turning violent and prompting many cities across the United States to impose curfews.Protesters in Minneapolis met a more determined response, and tensions rose in Los Angeles, where memories of Rodney King are still raw.Officials blamed outsiders for stoking violence, but have little evidence. Here’s the latest.

Analysis: In Days of Discord, a President Fans the FlamesPresident Trump has presented himself as someone who seeks conflict, not conciliation, a fighter, not a peacemaker. And he has lived up to his self-image at an inopportune time.
President Trump threatened protesters outside the White House with “vicious dogs” and “ominous weapons.”

Trump Postpones G7 Meeting After Angela Merkel Says She Won’t AttendThe German chancellor announced she would not travel to the U.S. for the G7.
